intro: Astrephia coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved astrephia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Astrephia coarctata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
